intro.p: MonoRail Helper that delivers AJAX capabilities.

note.p:
The following libraries are exposed:
Prototype Simplify ajax programming, among other goodies
Behaviour Uses css selectors to bind javascript code to DOM elements

section.title: AjaxHelper()
section.p: Initializes a new instance of the Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.AjaxHelper class.

section.title: Service(IServiceProvider provider)
section.p: Invoked by the framework in order to give a chance to obtain other services

section.title: GetJavascriptFunctions() : String
section.p: Renders a Javascript library inside a single script tag.

section.title: GetBehaviourFunctions() : String
section.p: Renders a script tag refering the Behaviour library code.

section.title: ReApply() : String
section.p: Renders a script block invoking Behaviour.apply()

section.title: AddLoadEvent(String loadFunctionName) : String
section.p: Renders a script block invoking Behaviour.addLoadEvent(loadFunctionName);

tr.td: The name of the js function to be invoked when the body is loaded

section.title: StartBehaviourRegister() : String
section.p: Renders a script block starting the association of events to selector rules

section.title: Register(String selector, String eventName, String jsFunctionName) : String
section.p: Adds a entry to a registration array. Invoking it with #form, onsubmit and validate will produce '#form' : function(e){ e.onsubmit = validate; },

tr.td: The name of the event on the element
The function to be invoked in response to the event

section.title: EndBehaviourRegister() : String
section.p: Renders the end of a script block that associated events to selector rules

section.title: GenerateJSProxy(String proxyName) : String
section.p: Generates an AJAX JavaScript proxy for the current controller.

tr.td: Name of the javascript proxy object

section.title: GenerateJSProxy(String proxyName, String controller) : String
section.p: Generates an AJAX JavaScript proxy for a given controller.

tr.td: Name of the javascript proxy object
Controller which will be target of the proxy

section.title: GenerateJSProxy(String proxyName, String area, String controller) : String
section.p: Generates an AJAX JavaScript proxy for a given controller.

tr.td: Name of the javascript proxy object
area which the controller belongs to
Controller which will be target of the proxy

section.title: LinkToFunction(String innerContent, String functionCodeOrName, IDictionary attributes) : String

p.p: Returns a link that will trigger a javascript function using the onclick handler and return false after the fact.

tr.td: Attributes to be applied to the html element

section.title: LinkToFunction(String innerContent, String functionCodeOrName) : String
section.p: Returns a link that will trigger a javascript function using the onclick handler and return false after the fact.

section.title: ButtonToFunction(String innerContent, String functionCodeOrName, IDictionary attributes) : String
section.p: Returns a button that will trigger a javascript function using the onclick handler and return false after the fact.

tr.td: Attributes to be applied to the input html element

section.title: ButtonToFunction(String innerContent, String functionCodeOrName) : String
section.p: Returns a button that will trigger a javascript function using the onclick handler and return false after the fact.

section.title: ButtonToRemote(String innerContent, String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Creates a button that if clicked will fire an Ajax invocation.

tr.td: The URL of the Ajax action
the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: ButtonToRemote(String innerContent, String url, IDictionary options, IDictionary htmloptions) : String
section.p: Creates a button that if clicked will fire an Ajax invocation.

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation
Attributes to be applied to the html element

section.title: LinkToRemote(String innerContent, String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Returns a link to a remote action defined by options["url"] that is called in the background using XMLHttpRequest. The result of that request can then be inserted into a DOM object whose id can be specified with options["update"]. Usually, the result would be a partial prepared by the controller

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: LinkToRemote(String innerContent, String url, IDictionary options, IDictionary htmloptions) : String
section.p: Returns a link to a remote action defined by options["url"] that is called in the background using XMLHttpRequest. The result of that request can then be inserted into a DOM object whose id can be specified with options["update"]. Usually, the result would be a partial prepared by the controller

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation
Attributes to be applied to the html element

section.title: BuildFormRemoteTag(String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Returns a form tag that will submit using XMLHttpRequest in the background instead of the regular reloading POST arrangement. Even though it is using Javascript to serialize the form elements, the form submission will work just like a regular submission as viewed by the receiving side (all elements available).

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: BuildFormRemoteTag(IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Returns a form tag that will submit using XMLHttpRequest in the background instead of the regular reloading POST arrangement. Even though it is using Javascript to serialize the form elements, the form submission will work just like a regular submission as viewed by the receiving side (all elements available).

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: ObserveField(String fieldId, Int32 frequency, String url, String idOfElementToBeUpdated, String with) : String
section.p: Observes the field with the DOM ID specified by fieldId and makes an Ajax when its contents have changed.

tr.td: The frequency (in seconds) at which changes to this field will be detected. (required)
url for the action to call when the field has changed (required)
Specifies the DOM ID of the element whose innerHTML should be updated with the XMLHttpRequest response text.
A Javascript expression specifying the parameters for the XMLHttpRequest. This defaults to 'value', which in the evaluated context refers to the new field value.

section.title: ObserveField(String fieldId, Int32 frequency, String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Observes the field with the DOM ID specified by fieldId and makes an Ajax when its contents have changed.

tr.td: The frequency (in seconds) at which changes to this field will be detected. (required)
url for the action to call when the field has changed (required)
the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: ObserveField(IDictionary options) : String
section.p:
Observes the field with the DOM ID specified by field and makes an Ajax call when its contents changes.
The following entries must exist in the dictionary:
fieldThe DOM field to be observed
urlurl to to call when the field has changed
frequencyThe frequency (in seconds) at which changes to this field will be detected
The following are optional entries:
updateSpecifies the DOM ID of the element whose innerHTML should be updated with the XMLHttpRequest response text
withA Javascript expression specifying the parameters for the XMLHttpRequest. This defaults to 'value', which in the evaluated context refers to the new field value

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: ObserveForm(String formId, Int32 frequency, String url, String idOfElementToBeUpdated, String with) : String
section.p: Works like the Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.AjaxHelper.ObserveField(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String), but operates on an entire form identified by the DOM ID formId. Options are the same as Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.AjaxHelper.ObserveField(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String), except the default value of the with option evaluates to the serialized (request String) value of the entire form.

tr.td: The frequency (in seconds) at which changes to this field will be detected. (required)
url for the action to call when the field has changed (required)
Specifies the DOM ID of the element whose innerHTML should be updated with the XMLHttpRequest response text.
A Javascript expression specifying the parameters for the XMLHttpRequest. This defaults to 'value', which in the evaluated context refers to the new field value.

section.title: ObserveForm(String formId, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Like Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.AjaxHelper.ObserveField(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String), but operates on an entire form identified by the DOM ID formId. options are the same as Castle.MonoRail.Framework.Helpers.AjaxHelper.ObserveField(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.String,System.String), except the default value of the with option evaluates to the serialized (request String) value of the entire form.

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: ObserveForm(IDictionary options) : String
section.p:
Observes all elements within a form with the DOM ID specified by form and makes an Ajax call when its contents changes.
The following entries must exist in the dictionary:
formThe form element id
urlurl to to call when the field has changed
frequencyThe frequency (in seconds) at which changes to this field will be detected
The following are optional entries:
updateSpecifies the DOM ID of the element whose innerHTML should be updated with the XMLHttpRequest response text
withA Javascript expression specifying the parameters for the XMLHttpRequest. This defaults to 'value', which in the evaluated context refers to the new field value

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: PeriodicallyCallRemote(IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Periodically invokes the specified url. You can use the options to override the default frequency (defaults to 10 seconds).

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: PeriodicallyCallRemote(String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Periodically invokes the specified url. You can use the options to override the default frequency (defaults to 10 seconds).

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: InputTextWithAutoCompletion(IDictionary options, IDictionary tagAttributes) : String
section.p:
Rendes a input field with Google style autocomplete enabled. The specified url is used to gather the contents for the auto complete panel, so and your action should return filtered and sorted results.
The following entries must exist in the options:
inputThe text input element id
urlurl to to call when the field has changed

note.p: it is assumed that the url invoked returns an unordered list.

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation
attributes for the input html element

section.title: InputTextWithAutoCompletion(String inputName, String url, IDictionary tagAttributes, IDictionary completionOptions) : String
section.p: Rendes a input field with Google style autocomplete enabled. The specified url is used to gather the contents for the auto complete panel, so and your action should return filtered and sorted results.

note.p: it is assumed that the url invoked returns an unordered list.

section.title: AutoCompleteInputText(String elementId, String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Generates an javascript block enabling auto completion for the specified input text id (elementId). You can specify the element to be updated using the options dictionary (key update), if you don't we assume elementId+autocomplete.

note.p: it is assumed that the url invoked returns an unordered list.

tr.td: The url to be invoked returning results
the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: BuildRemoteFunction(String url, IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Returns a function that makes a remote invocation, using the supplied parameters

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation

section.title: RemoteFunction(IDictionary options) : String
section.p: Returns a function that makes a remote invocation, using the supplied parameters

tr.td: the options for the Ajax invocation
